name: Propanediol (PG)
discription: Propylene Glycol (1,2-Propanediol) is a synthetic organic compound, a viscous, colorless liquid which is nearly odorless but possesses a faintly sweet taste. It is miscible with a broad range of solvents, including water, acetone, and chloroform.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 76.09, Flash Point: 104°C, Boiling point: 187.3°C, Density (20°C): 1.0381 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.01 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 56 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.432, Surface Tension (25°C): 38 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: colorless sticky and steady absorbent liquid.
food_idustry: Used as a food additive (E1520) - humectant, solvent for flavorings and colorings, stabilizer, and thickener. Used in pet food and animal feed.
pharmaceutical_industry: Widely used as an excipient (solvent, plasticizer, humectant, preservative) in pharmaceutical formulations including oral, topical, and injectable medications. Solvent for active ingredients.
other_industries: Solvent in paints, coatings, and inks; humectant in cosmetics and personal care products; component of antifreeze and de-icing fluids; hydraulic fluids; plasticizers; raw material for polyester resins and polyurethanes; smoke machine fluid.

name: Dipropylene Glycol (DPG)
discription: Dipropylene Glycol is a mixture of three isomeric organic compounds. It is a colorless, nearly odorless liquid with a high boiling point and low toxicity, used as a solvent, plasticizer, and chemical intermediate.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 134.2, Flash Point: 138°C, Boiling point: 229°C, Density (20°C): 1.0252 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.01 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 75 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.439, Surface Tension (25°C): 35 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless viscous liquid.
food_idustry: Used as a solvent for flavors and fragrances, and in non-food contact applications.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent and coupling agent in pharmaceutical formulations, particularly topical creams and lotions.
other_industries: Solvent for fragrances in perfumes and cosmetics; hydraulic brake fluids; cutting oils; textile lubricants; coatings; plasticizer for resins; industrial solvent for inks and agricultural chemicals.

name: Tripropylene Glycol (TPG)
discription: Tripropylene Glycol is a colorless, odorless, viscous liquid. It is completely miscible with water and many organic solvents, used as a solvent, intermediate, and in various industrial applications.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 192.253, Flash Point: 146°C, Boiling point: 273°C, Density (20°C): 1.021 g/cm³, Viscosity (25°C): Not specified clearly (value appears under DPG), Refractive Index (25°C): 1.452, Surface Tension (25°C): 35.8 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can be used as a solvent or plasticizer in specific pharmaceutical applications.
other_industries: Solvent in coatings, inks, and cleaners; intermediate in the production of urethanes, esters, and resins; textile processing; gas dehydration and purification.

name: Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether (PM)
discription: Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether (PGME or 1-methoxy-2-propanol) is a colorless liquid with an ether-like odor. It is a versatile solvent with good solvency for a wide range of resins and dyes.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 90.1, Flash Point: 31°C, Boiling point: 120°C, Density (20°C): 0.919 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 8.7 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 1.7 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.404, Surface Tension (25°C): 27.7 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in some pharmaceutical preparations and in the synthesis of active pharmaceutical ingredients.
other_industries: Solvent for paints, coatings, inks, lacquers, resins, dyes, and cleaners; electronics industry (photoresist solvent); chemical intermediate; coupling agent in water-based coatings.

name: Dipropylene Glycol Methyl Ether (DPM)
discription: Dipropylene Glycol Methyl Ether is a mid-to-slow evaporating solvent with excellent solvency characteristics. It's a colorless liquid with a mild, pleasant odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 148.2, Flash Point: 75°C, Boiling point: 184°C, Density (20°C): 0.945-0.957 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.2 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 3.7 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.422, Surface Tension (25°C): 28 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can be used as a solvent or coalescing agent in some pharmaceutical formulations and processes.
other_industries: Solvent for coatings (water-based and solvent-based), inks, cleaners (household and industrial), textile dyeing; coupling agent; coalescing agent in latex paints; agricultural formulations.

name: Tripropylene Glycol Methyl Ether (TPM)
discription: Tripropylene Glycol Methyl Ether is a slow-evaporating solvent with good solvency for various resins and excellent coupling properties. It is a colorless liquid.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 206.3, Flash Point: 124°C, Boiling point: 236°C, Density (20°C): 0.965 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 1.7 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 5.5 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.43, Surface Tension (25°C): 29 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: May find use as a specialty solvent or carrier in certain pharmaceutical applications requiring slow evaporation.
other_industries: Solvent for coatings, inks, and cleaners; coalescing agent in latex paints; component in brake fluids; chemical intermediate.

name: 1-Butoxy-2-Propanol (PNB)
discription: 1-Butoxy-2-Propanol (Propylene Glycol n-Butyl Ether) is a colorless liquid solvent with a mild odor, belonging to the P-series glycol ethers. It offers good solvency and coupling ability.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 132.2, Flash Point: 62.5°C, Boiling point: 165°C, Density (20°C): 0.878 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 1.05 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 26.5 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.416, Surface Tension (25°C): 29 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in specific pharmaceutical formulations or manufacturing processes.
other_industries: Solvent for paints, coatings, resins, dyes, inks, and cleaners; coupling agent in water-based systems; degreasing agent; chemical intermediate.

name: Dipropylene Glycol Mono Butyl Ether (DPNB)
discription: Dipropylene Glycol Mono Butyl Ether is a slow-evaporating, highly versatile solvent. It is a colorless liquid with good solvency for a variety of resins and effective coupling properties.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 190.28, Flash Point: 87.5°C, Boiling point: 222°C, Density (20°C): 0.91 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.04 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 4.9 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.426, Surface Tension (25°C): 29 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: May be used as a solvent or coalescing agent in pharmaceutical formulations.
other_industries: Solvent in coatings (waterborne and solvent-borne), inks, cleaners (household and industrial), textile processing, agricultural formulations; coalescing aid for latex paints; chemical intermediate.

name: Tri(propylene glycol) Butyl Ether (TPNB)
discription: Tri(propylene glycol) Butyl Ether is a very slow-evaporating glycol ether solvent with excellent solvency and coupling characteristics. It is a colorless liquid.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 248.4, Flash Point: 126°C, Boiling point: 268°C, Density (20°C): 0.93 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.01 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 7.0 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.433, Surface Tension (25°C): 30 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Could be used as a specialty solvent in certain pharmaceutical applications where very slow evaporation and high solvency are needed.
other_industries: Coalescing agent in latex coatings; solvent for high-bake coatings, inks, and cleaners; plasticizer; chemical intermediate.

name: 1-propoxypropan-2-ol (PNP)
discription: 1-propoxypropan-2-ol (Propylene Glycol n-Propyl Ether) is a colorless liquid solvent used in coatings, inks, and cleaning formulations. It offers a balance of solvency and evaporation rate.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 118.2, Flash Point: 48°C, Boiling point: 149°C, Density (20°C): 0.883 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 2.85 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 2.4 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.411, Surface Tension (25°C): 25 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in some pharmaceutical processes and formulations.
other_industries: Solvent for paints, coatings, resins, dyes, inks, and cleaners; coupling agent; chemical intermediate.

name: Di(propylene glycol) Propyl Ether (DPNP)
discription: Di(propylene glycol) Propyl Ether is a slow-evaporating solvent with good solvency for various resins and effective coupling properties. It's a colorless liquid.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 176.2, Flash Point: 88°C, Boiling point: 213°C, Density (20°C): 0.919 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.08 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 3.9 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.424, Surface Tension (25°C): 28 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can be used as a solvent or coalescent in pharmaceutical applications.
other_industries: Solvent for coatings, inks, and cleaners; coalescing aid in latex paints; component in brake fluids; chemical intermediate.

name: 1-phenoxypropan-2-ol (PPH)
discription: 1-phenoxypropan-2-ol (Propylene Glycol Phenyl Ether) is a slow-evaporating glycol ether with excellent solvency for resins. It's a colorless to light greenish liquid.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 152.2, Flash Point: 115°C, Boiling point: 243°C, Density (20°C): 1.062 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.01 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 25.2 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.53, Surface Tension (25°C): 38 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless or green liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a preservative and solvent in some cosmetic and pharmaceutical topical preparations. Can act as a fixative.
other_industries: Coalescing agent in architectural and industrial coatings; solvent for resins, dyes, and inks; dye carrier for textiles; preservative in cosmetics; biocide.

name: 1-Ethoxy-2-propanol (PE)
discription: 1-Ethoxy-2-propanol (Propylene Glycol Ethyl Ether) is a colorless liquid solvent with a mild ether-like odor. It's used in various applications including coatings and cleaners.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 104.15, Flash Point: 43°C, Boiling point: 132°C, Density (20°C): 0.9 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.96 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 1.8 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.405, Surface Tension (25°C): 30 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent in pharmaceutical processing.
other_industries: Solvent for paints, coatings, inks, resins, dyes, and cleaners; coupling agent; chemical intermediate.

name: Propyonic Glycol Methyl Ether Propionate (PMP)
discription: Propylene Glycol Methyl Ether Propionate is a glycol ether ester solvent with good solvency for a variety of resins and a moderate evaporation rate.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 146, Flash Point: 56°C, Boiling point: 157°C, Density (20°C): 0.948 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.9 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 1.1 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.405, Surface Tension (25°C): 34 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: May be used as a specialty solvent in pharmaceutical formulations or synthesis.
other_industries: Solvent in coatings, inks, and cleaners; active solvent for cellulose acetate butyrate, nitrocellulose, epoxies, acrylics, and urethanes.

name: Propylene Glycol Methyl Ether Acetate (PMA)
discription: Propylene Glycol Methyl Ether Acetate (PGMEA) is a medium evaporating solvent with excellent solvency for a wide range of resins, widely used in coatings and electronics.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 132.2, Flash Point: 47°C, Boiling point: 146°C, Density (20°C): 0.966 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 3.8 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 1.1 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.4, Surface Tension (25°C): 27 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can be used as a solvent in pharmaceutical manufacturing processes, particularly where good resin solvency is required.
other_industries: Key solvent in coatings (automotive, industrial, architectural), inks (screen printing, gravure), electronics industry (photoresist processing, LCD production, cleaning agents); solvent for polyurethane resins, acrylics, epoxies.

name: Di(propylene glycol) Methyl Ether Acetate (DPMA)
discription: Di(propylene glycol) Methyl Ether Acetate is a slow-evaporating glycol ether ester solvent with excellent solvency, flow, and leveling properties, used in high-performance coatings.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 190.2, Flash Point: 86°C, Boiling point: 200°C, Density (20°C): 0.975 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.0836 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 2.2 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.414, Surface Tension (25°C): 28 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: May find use as a specialty solvent in pharmaceutical applications requiring slow evaporation and good solvency.
other_industries: Solvent for coatings (automotive OEM and refinish, industrial maintenance), inks, cleaners; coalescing agent; reduces surface tension in waterborne coatings.

name: PGDA
discription: Propylene Glycol Diacetate (PGDA) is a colorless liquid with a mild, ester-like odor. It is used as a solvent, coalescing agent, and plasticizer.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 160, Flash Point: 86°C, Boiling point: 191°C, Density (20°C): 1.056 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.23 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 2.6 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.413, Surface Tension (25°C): 32.5 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Used as a solvent or plasticizer in certain pharmaceutical formulations.
other_industries: Solvent in coatings, inks, and adhesives; coalescing agent in latex paints; plasticizer for resins; foundry core binder solvent; component in cleaning formulations.

name: Dipropylene Glycol Dimethyl Ether (DMM)
discription: Dipropylene Glycol Dimethyl Ether (also known as Proglyde DMM) is an aprotic solvent with excellent solvency, good chemical stability, and a low odor.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 162.2, Flash Point: 65°C, Boiling point: 175°C, Density (20°C): 0.902 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.55 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 26.5 mPa·s (This viscosity value seems unusually high for DMM compared to similar solvents and might be for a different substance or an error; typical DMM viscosity is ~1 mPa·s. Will use the image data.), Refractive Index (25°C): 1.416, Surface Tension (25°C): 26.3 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Can serve as a reaction solvent in pharmaceutical synthesis due to its aprotic nature and good solvency. Solvent for polyurethane formulations.
other_industries: Solvent for polyurethane systems (coatings, adhesives, elastomers); cleaning formulations (electronics, precision parts); reaction solvent in chemical synthesis; paint strippers.

name: DALPAD.C
discription: DALPAD.C appears to be a trade name for Tri(propylene glycol) Butyl Ether (TPNB), a very slow-evaporating glycol ether solvent with excellent solvency.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 248.36 (MF in image: C13H24O3; FW in image C13H28O4 for TPNB earlier: 248.4. The MF listed C13H24O3 seems inconsistent with TPNB and FW of 248.36, more like a C13 tri-oxygenated ether. Assuming based on CAS, it's TPNB and the MF has a typo here), Flash Point: 125.6°C, Boiling point: 276°C, Density (20°C): 0.93 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.01 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 7.0 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.433, Surface Tension (25°C): 30 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Specialty solvent in applications requiring very slow evaporation and high solvency, if consistent with TPNB.
other_industries: Coalescing agent, solvent for coatings, inks, cleaners, if consistent with TPNB.

name: DALPAD.D
discription: DALPAD.D appears to be a trade name, possibly for Di(propylene glycol) n-Butyl Ether (DPNB) given the similar properties and applications, though CAS 29911-28-2 is for Di(propylene glycol) Butyl Ether, while DPNP had CAS 29911-27-1. There's ambiguity. (Note: The CAS 29911-28-2 is more commonly associated with DPNB rather than DPNP. I will proceed as if it's a DPNB-like product). It is a slow-evaporating solvent with good solvency.
typical_properties: Formula Weight: 190.3 (MF in image: C10H22O3. This is consistent with DPNB FW of 190.28), Flash Point: 94°C, Boiling point: 222-232°C, Density (20°C): 0.91 g/cm³, Vapour Pressure (20°C): 0.04 mmHg, Viscosity (25°C): 4.9 mPa·s, Refractive Index (25°C): 1.426, Surface Tension (25°C): 29 dynes/cm. Physical Properties: Colorless liquid.
pharmaceutical_industry: Solvent or coalescing agent in pharmaceutical formulations, if similar to DPNB.
other_industries: Solvent in coatings, inks, cleaners; coalescing aid; chemical intermediate, if similar to DPNB.
